lead_paragraph: Other financial regulators are expected to follow suit, giving the Trump administration an opening to shift the government’s approach to policing the industry.

byline.original: By BEN PROTESS and ALEXANDRA STEVENSON

headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Chief  Among First to Plan Exit
headline.main: Mary Jo White to Step Down as S.E.C. Chief

snippet: Other financial regulators are expected to follow suit, giving the Trump administration an opening to shift the government’s approach to policing the industry....
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission chairwoman Mary Jo White announces plans to leave agency, first major Obama administration appointee to resign following upset victory of Donald J Trump; her exodus signals looming change in regulatory leadership and enforcement.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
